ADVOCATE.Defintion: to publicly support or suggest an idea, development, or way of doing something

ALL OF THE TRAPPINGS.Defintion: all the things that are part of or typical of a particular job, situation, or event

CASE STUDY.Defintion: a detailed account giving information about the development of a person, group, or thing, especially in order to show general principles

CEO.Defintion: abbreviation for chief executive officer the person with the most important position in a company

CEOS.Defintion: abbreviation for chief executive officer the person with the most important position in a company

CORRELATION.Defintion: a connection or relationship between two or more facts, numbers, etc.

CRUNCHED THE NUMBERS.Defintion: to do mathematical work involving large amounts of information or numbers

CUSHION.Defintion: something that makes the effects of a bad situation less severe

CUSTOMER BASE.Defintion: the people who buy or use a particular product or service

DEVIATION.Defintion: to do something that is different from the usual or common way of behaving

DICTATES.Defintion: to give orders, or tell someone exactly what they must do, with total authority

DUST HAD SETTLED.Defintion: If the dust settles after an argument or big change, the situation becomes calmer

ENLIGHTENED.Defintion: showing understanding, acting in a positive way, and not following old-fashioned or false beliefs

FOLLOWED HIS LEAD.Defintion: followed the example of someone or something

FRONTLINE.Defintion: used to describe an employee who deals directly with customers, or who is directly involved in making a product

HAZARD PAY.Defintion: extra money that is paid to someone because their job is dangerous

HIGH LIFE.Defintion: an exciting way of living in which rich and successful people enjoy themselves by spending a lot of time and money in fashionable places

INEFFICIENT.Defintion: not organised, skilled, or able to work in a satisfactory way

INFLUX.Defintion: the fact of a large number of people or things arriving at the same time

LUXURY.Defintion: great comfort, especially as provided by expensive and beautiful things

MAKE ENDS MEET.Defintion: to have just enough money to pay for the things that you need

MBA.Defintion: abbreviation for Master of Business Administration: an advanced degree in business, or a person who has this degree

MEDIA COVERAGE.Defintion: the reporting of a particular important event or subject by the media

MOCKED.Defintion: to laugh at someone, often by copying them in a funny but unkind way

NET WORTH.Defintion: the value of the assets (= property and money) that a​ person or ​business has, after any ​debts are taken away

PLAIN SAILING.Defintion: to be easy and without problems

PREDICTED.Defintion: to say that an event or action will happen in the future, especially as a result of knowledge or experience

RADICAL.Defintion: believing or expressing the belief that there should be great or extreme social or political change

RESIGNED.Defintion: to give up a job or position by telling your employer that you are leaving

REVENUE.Defintion: the income that a government or company receives regularly

SHAREHOLDERS.Defintion: a person who owns shares in a company and therefore gets part of the company's profits and the right to vote on how the company is controlled

STOCKS.Defintion: part of the ownership of a company that can be bought by members of the public

WAGE.Defintion: a particular amount of money that is paid, usually every week, to an employee, especially one who does work that needs physical skills or strength, rather than a job needing a college education

WEATHER.Defintion: to deal successfully with a difficult situation or a problem
